§3§lTwo timers?

§r§8Each player has his own timer, which means that player 1 has stopped his timer and the timer from player 2 still counts.

scenes.text:
§3§lMode

§r§8The timer can be set through the menu or §l/function timer/mode§r§8 §l§bstarted, §4stopped§r§8 or §l§7invisible§r§8 as long as a host player has set local control. Each time you get a §lFeedback§r§8 what has been set or whether the mode is available. If the timer is §l§7invisible§r§8, then it will run in the background, so it will count, but is not displayed.

scenes.text:
§c§lAdmins

§r§8All players with a tag §l/tag "name" add trust_player_control§r§8 are admins. They can change the control between local and global. If the local control is active, they can also read out the settings or the time of each player via status. In the case of global control, the Start-time sub-item appears here. This allows them to set a time from which the timer to counts down.
on_close_commands: execute if score action timer_menu matches 0 run scoreboard players set id timer_menu 1
close menu
execute if score action timer_menu matches 1 run scoreboard players set action timer_menu 0

scenes.text:
§3§lCustom Music

§r§8§lRequirements:§r§8
1. All sound files must be in OGG format
2. A resource pack

§lSetup:§r§8
1. Navigate to the file location of the timer (you can find it by clicking the green checkmark when you activated it).

2. Open the folder "subpacks"

3. Open the folder "s"

4. Follow the instructions in "sound_keys.txt"

scenes.text:
§3§lControl

§r§8Admins can change control between local and global in the settings. With local settings, each player can change their own timer and set it as they wish. With a global setting, the timer is shared by the player who activates the mode with every other player on the server / world. Only admins can then manage the timer and deactivate the control again, provided the player who activated the global control is online
